pull.title: Scripts and tools: Obsolete #!/bin/bash shebang
pull.body:
> `#!/bin/bash` assumes it is always installed to `/bin/` which can cause issues
> `#!/usr/bin/env bash` searches the user's `PATH` to find the `bash` binary

Details: https://github.com/dylanaraps/pure-bash-bible#obsolete-syntax

I'm open to comments: Should I also fix `#!/bin/sh`?

events.body: Did you bruteforce that hash? What did you use as the nonce?

@luke-jr 

```
git log --format=fuller 0000000 -1
commit 000000035b20402dea3e8168165cd4eefdc97539
Author:     DesWurstes <DesWurstes@users.noreply.github.com>
AuthorDate: Wed Jun 20 12:54:54 2018 +0300
Commit:     DesWurstes <DesWurstes@users.noreply.github.com>
CommitDate: Wed Jun 20 11:12:41 2018 +0300

    Obsolete #!/bin/bash shebang
Timestamp, it is two hours earlier than the actual commit time.

Agree that this is better. BSD ports tend to install `bash` to `/usr/local`, for example.

> I'm open to comments: Should I also fix #!/bin/sh?

I'd say, no. `/bin/sh` is by definition the system shell. Use of the system shell has its own issues (like the script having to be compatible with 80's shell dialect, the lowest common denominator of all shells), but the location is not one of them.

utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/000000035b20402dea3e8168165cd4eefdc97539

issue.title: commits from bitcoin/master
issue.body:
Qt: load wallet in UI after possible init aborts
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13506

Add unloadwallet RPC
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13111

[qa] mininode: Expose connection state through is_connected
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13512

For AVX2 code, also check for AVX, XSAVE, and OS support
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13471

gui: Drop qt4 support
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13458

Avoid copies in range-for loops and add a warning to detect them
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13480

Scripts and tools: Obsolete #!/bin/bash shebang
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13510

build: Move rpc/util.cpp from libbitcoin-util to libbitcoin-server
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13486

Test: Harden lint-filenames.sh
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13496

bench: Add block assemble benchmark
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13219

wallet: Unlock spent outputs
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13160

bench: Add missing pow.h header
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13530

issue.title: Scripts and tools: Use #!/usr/bin/env bash instead of #!/bin/bash.
issue.body: As it was discussed in [#13510](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13510), it is better to use `#!/usr/bin/env bash` instead of `#!/bin/bash`.

issue.title: Docs: Adds development guidelines about Scripts shebang to developer-notes.md.
issue.body:
Based on [#13510](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13510) and [#14831](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14831), I added some development guidelines about Scripts shebang to `developer-notes.md`.

I look forward to hearing your opinions about this.

issue.title: Backport useful lints from upstream
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6892
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11151
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11300
- bitcoin/bitcoin@96d91b79bdfe1c0a58bd645f0f1d657caba16deb

subsequent PR.
